etymology.description: 再(再) (zài, "again") + 见(見) (jiàn, "see") = indicating seeing each other again -> goodbye
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 再见(再見) (zàijiàn, "goodbye") literally means 'see [you] again,' implying a future meeting. This aligns with the sentiment of partings, where there is a hope or expectation of reuniting in the future.

examples.chinese: 我要回家了(我要回家了)，再见(再見)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yào huí jiā le, zàijiàn.

examples.chinese: 朋友们快走吧(朋友們快走吧)，再见(再見)。
examples.pinyin: Péngyǒu men kuài zǒu ba, zàijiàn.
examples.english: Friends, hurry up and leave, goodbye.
